description: Easy homemade Pepperoni Pizza made with homemade or store-bought pizza dough is so EASY and delicious, and way cheaper than eating out!
ingredients: [{"name": "active dry yeast", "units": "teaspoons", "amount": "2 1/4"}, {"name": "granulated sugar", "units": "teaspoons", "amount": "2"}, {"name": "warm water", "units": "cups", "amount": "1 1/2"}, {"name": "olive oil", "units": "Tablespoons", "amount": "3"}, {"name": "salt", "units": "teaspoons", "amount": "1 1/2"}, {"name": "white vinegar", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": "1"}, {"name": "bread flour", "units": "cups", "amount": "3 ¾ – 4"}, {"name": "pizza sauce", "units": "cup", "amount": "1"}, {"name": "pepperoni", "units": "cups", "amount": "2"}, {"name": "shredded mozzarella cheese", "units": "cups", "amount": "4"}, {"name": "freshly grated parmesan cheese", "units": "cup", "amount": "0.5"}, {"name": "Italian seasoning", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": "1"}]
instructions: 1. Make the Pizza Dough: Combine warm water with sugar and yeast. Let rest for 5 minutes. Add remaining warm water, olive oil, salt, and vinegar. Mix and knead for about 7 minutes. Allow to rise for 1 to 1.5 hours. 2. Roll out the dough and divide into pieces. 3. Preheat oven to 450°F. Pre-bake dough for 3-4 minutes. 4. Add pizza sauce and toppings. Bake for 5-12 minutes until golden.
nutrition_info: Calories: 305, Carbohydrates: 24g, Protein: 14g, Fat: 17g, Saturated Fat: 7g, Cholesterol: 39mg, Sodium: 746mg, Potassium: 146mg, Fiber: 1g, Sugar: 1g.
notes: You can use store-bought dough if preferred. Variations include adding hot honey, fresh basil, or different meats.
